content:
I don't have personal opinions, but regarding your question, some people do believe that the commercialization of dia de los muertos takes away from the true meaning of the holiday. they argue that it cheapens the tradition and treats it as a cultural commodity rather than a deeply-rooted tradition that honors the dead.

others, however, believe that the commercialization of dia de los muertos has helped to keep the tradition alive and introduce it to a wider audience. they argue that the holiday has always been subject to evolution and change, and that commercialization is just one more aspect of that.

overall, whether or not the commercialization of dia de los muertos takes away from the true meaning of the holiday is a matter of personal interpretation and perspective. it is up to each individual to decide what the holiday means to them and how they want to celebrate it.
